message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.IR 

This paper is primarily focused on face presentation attack detection (PAD) and face recognition systems (FRS), which are both subfields of computer vision (cs.CV). The use of wax figure faces as a novel and super-realistic 3D face presentation attack also involves the use of materials and fabrication techniques, which could fall under multimedia (cs.MM) or human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the potential security risks of face spoofing, which could be relevant to computer security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper uses a multi-feature voting scheme for detection, which could involve machine learning (cs.IR).
